topics.author: 5239db6da4c72d22d9000358

topics.body:
"@SidewardManatee":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559f562d636872767900070a#post_559f562d636872767900070a

"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559f570363687225c5000179#post_559f570363687225c5000179

It does damage but you'd have to couple that with staying up all night which deteriorates eyesight anyways due to dehydration of the pupils, there's having the screen blindingly bright which is idiotic and anyone who does is blind already to begin with.

Not saying that it isn't harmful, I'm sure it is, but not to the degree parents say. Need I remind you people used to say the radio caused cancer and would made you deaf when it was the big thing back in the day?

topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/559f570363687225c5000179#post_559f570363687225c5000179
Old OLD TVs screens gave off radiation that effected eyes. That's where the myth starts but now anything that screens will do is cause slight eye pain from blinking less. So dry eyes.

But screen will do nothing to harm you

I've been wearing a pair of cargo shorts all day because it's hot and they're comfortable. And I just reached into one of the pockets and pulled out the most random fucking thing. A pink can cozy that reads "I Got This!" in big white letters. I don't own anything like this fucking thing and I just found it in the pocket of my shorts! I'm kinda freaking out a bit!
